Description: As a user, I need the system to handle high conversation volumes without performance degradation so I can rely on Insights Copilot for critical business decisions.

Title 2: Ensure system can handle production conversation volumes
Description: As a business user, I need the system to maintain fast response times even during peak usage hours so my analysis workflow isn't disrupted
Acceptance Criteria: **Need to revisit and set success criteria**- Select optimal database for conversation history management for engine irrespective of app or together- System maintains <2s response time for 200+ concurrent users- No conversation data loss under load

Title 2: Optimize Redis storage - resource, access and security
Description: As a user, I need my conversation data to be secure and properly isolated so I can trust the system with sensitive business information and other system activities don't impact my experience
Acceptance Criteria: - Dedicated Redis resource created if Redis chosen as resource for conversation management- Performance isolated from other services- User data properly isolated- Access controls implemented- Storage optimization reduces latency by XX%

Title 2: App conversation storage
Acceptance Criteria:
* Tree structure is not required for Edit/Regenerate. Need to check for UI rendering
*  Whole history cannot be provided from engine as API will be overloaded. BE should handle conversation history.

Description: As a user, I need Insights Copilot to intelligently understand my questions and dynamically choose the best approach to answer them so I get accurate insights without having to specify how to retrieve data

Title 2: UAT with beta users using Figma prototypes for end state alignment
Acceptance Criteria:
* Prototype demonstrates end state with chat bar and smart flows integrated in the agentic orchestration
* Set expectations on current Dev experiment and how it is different from the Prototype * interim staging vs end state
* User feedback on 5 sets of flows -
  1. Chatbar
  2. Loader (basic)
  3. Response and artefacts
  4. Sources and Citations
  5. Charts \& Tables
  6. Smart Flows

Title 2: Usecase MLE onboarding to Chat+ with testing guidelines
Acceptance Criteria: * Walkthrough to usecase MLEs on changelog, new architecture, prompt structure* Baseline for testing and feedback collection for individual usecases* Separate session for prompting guidelines, Langfuse onboarding - tracing, feedback, GT management and testing"* Prompting guidelines for new components - planner, evaluator, final answer tool and updates for existing tools

Title 2: Conversation Name for history sidebar
Acceptance Criteria:
* Conversation name generated using the first question
* Generation is async to not delay responses
* In case latency is high or generation fails, default to question 
* Populate conversation history sidebar using this name replacing "New Chat"

Title 2: Clarifications from user
Acceptance Criteria:
* When Insights Copilot is not sure about the query or needs more information to respond, it can ask user for clarification
* Clarifications can be asked in planning step as well as during tool execution
* Clarificatory questions should be easy to understand and respond to.

Title 1: Rich Content Responses with Analytis Templates/Smart Flows
Description: **What are Smart Flows/ Analysis Templates?**    Insights Copilot uses pre-defined functions to generate an answer in a known workflow from structured datasets as per business use case consistently and accurately. Not every question is going to be addressed through analysis templates, a portion of questions will still be generated using NL2SQL.**What does Analysis Templates solve for?**  *   **Improved control over answer structure**    *  Picking KPIs and Answer sources    *  Summarization    *  Deterministic Visualizations - Tables and Charts*   **Seamless chat integration with additional depth**      Integrates in the chat bar with better deep-dive as per business workflows, almost like generating a report from a single chat.*   **Reproducibility and Accuracy**      Ensures that there is little to no variance in the answer generated, no matter how many times the user asks with the same intent.**Feature Success Metrics:**  1.  90%+ queries answered using an analysis template2.  95%+ accuracy for all queries answered via an analysis template3.  99%+ reproducibility for all queries answered via an analysis template4.  30% faster responses through Smart flow cards compared to chat route (via landing page or chat tool)**Product Metrics:**  1.  10-20% engagement improvement (# queries asked)2.  30-40% satisfaction improvement (CSAT)

Title 2: UAT for New Smart Flow/Analysis Template artefact with stakeholders
Description: As a user, I need to see how improved smart flow responses will look and function so I can provide feedback on the design.
Acceptance Criteria: - Prototype demonstrates new responses with and without report artefacts and added interactions - User feedback collected

Title 2: POC - Reference analysis_tool response in final response
Description: As a user, I need to easily refer to complex analysis reports in the responses from Insights Copilot so I can use them in business workflows
Acceptance Criteria: - Users can interact and follow-up on the reports within the response. Insights Copilot also understands that the response has report(s).  - Only complex ATs show up as reports. Segregate simple retrieval ATs and complex ATs (eg. get_brand_kpis vs get_country_highlights in BG).   - Response can refer to the report(s) eg. ```"I have prepared a detailed report for you which you can refer to below. <Report artefact link/object>"```- Users can open and read the reports when available   - More than one report scenario in a response is supported.- Users can copy the response and export the reports as PPT, PDF and Markdown for later use.- Reports persist across sessions, page refresh- Payload size should be within 1MB

Title 2: Markdown based Analysis Template/Smart Flow reports
Description: As a user, I need business analyses to be displayed in a clean, structured format so I can go through the report with ease of understanding.
Acceptance Criteria: - Analysis tool response is in markdown format with embedding/link inside the response- Sources (and citations) are handled properly within markdown

Title 2: Smart Flows in new Agentic orchestration
Description: As a user, I want to trigger and run smartflows so that I can retrieve deep dive reports more reliably with high reproduciblity.
Acceptance Criteria: - Smart Flows are enabled in the Chat Bar even when Chat+ is enabled- Smart Flow is triggered with known AT function and parameters selected by the user in agentic orchestration- Results are summarized and report is attached along with the response according to #142215

Description: As a user, I want to request for charts and customizations and interact with them so I can explore trends with ease

Title 2: Plotly Chart customizations
Acceptance Criteria:
* Finalize what customizations are possible to match the UX requirements
* Distribute customizations between LLM (colour scheme) and UI (theme, font).
  * Ensure minimal customizations are handled by UI to allow user to ask for customization via Chat.
  * Expected UI customizations: Theme (Background \& Text colour), Font Family (Avantt), Font size
  * Toolbar placement - Option 1 - outside chart area
  * Toolbar placement - Option 2 - inside chart area as a collapsible toggle
  * Expected LLM customizations (Chart Type, Chart Data, Colour scheme, Chart Name, Axes selection and name, Legends etc.)

Description: As a user, I want to request for tables and table customizations and interact with them so that I can read the data with ease.

Title 2: Multiple tables and charts in same response
Acceptance Criteria:
* Sequential positioning of table and chart in Markdown response. Eg. 
Table 1
Chart 1
Table 2
Chart 2
...
* AT artefact with accordions
   * Inside accordions, re-enable tabbed groups of tables and charts 
   * If tabs are not possible, then maintain sequential positioning

Title 2: Column Filters based on data type
Acceptance Criteria: * Data type identification for filters to work properly - numeric, datetime, string (currently defaults to string)

Description: As a user,  I want responses from IC to select information from most relevant sources (unstructured, structured or internet) or combine with multiple sources so that I can have the most holistic answer

Title 2: Performance test for usecases with multiple tool calling
Acceptance Criteria: * Test and collect feedback from respective usecase teams - BrewGPT S&P, LCP Coaching Assistant, CPG Intel  * BrewGPT S&P and LCP Coaching Assistant - GT curation for cases involving structured OR unstructured tool and cross-followups (structured turn 1 -> unstructured turn 2 and vice versa)  * CPG Intel - GT curation for cases involving unstructured OR/AND internet tool and cross-followups

Title 2: Question to response language match
Acceptance Criteria:
* Prompt revision to instruct LLM to maintain language
* Check response language and terminology before sending final response
   * Translate/improve response based on evaluation

Title 2: Unstructured citations
Acceptance Criteria: * Responses are in markdown format with citations* Citations cover the document name, blob url, extracted chunk, page number* If part of the response, Blob URLs are formatted on UI to open inside IC

Title 2: Internet citations
Acceptance Criteria: * Responses are in markdown format with citations* Citations cover the external url and extracted chunk

Title 2: Structured citations
Responses related to Product and Usecase
Acceptance Criteria: * Response context which is understandable by a business user. Prompts are currently referring to technical data such as table join information etc.* Knowledge base for a usecase only fetches information from the particular* Product knowledge base should not borrow information from usecases

Title 2: Langfuse roles with IC RBAC
Acceptance Criteria: * Shared auth middleware with IC <> Langfuse  * Two possible approaches:     * ❌ Each Usecase as Project - more time needed but granular control (Phase 2 if needed)    * ✅Single project approach - simple implementation but risky since all access to everyone  * Standardized Nomenclature and access translation between IC and Langfuse

Title 2: Langfuse governance framework
Acceptance Criteria:
* RACI Matrix across core product and usecase teams to clarify roles and responsibilities
* Governance process for reviewing the project access control and other features - tracing, annotation, testing and prompt management
* Prepare Langfuse documentation for developers
  * How to annotate trace
  * How to maintain GT and run 
  * How to update prompts
* Prompt management Pre-requisite
  * Clean up for system prompts - DONE
  * Clean up for usecase prompts - BG

Title 2: Langfuse tracing and feedback management
Acceptance Criteria:
* All traces from UI (all envs), local setup are captured
* Feedback from UI (all envs) are captured against respective trace
* Developer can view all feedback at a usecase level in one place

Title 2: Langfuse for running tests and validation
Acceptance Criteria:
* Testers can run questions in bulk
* Each question can be validation using annotation

Title 2: Langfuse for managing ground truth and benchmarking
Acceptance Criteria:
* Ground truths for each usecase can be managed - read, update, delete
* Cases with different complexities can be covered - turns, language, data sources etc.
* Business users/developers can validate the question+response pair 
* After every change, tests can be run to validate against ground truth as benchmark
* Scores can help developers determine the change with ease

Title 2: Langfuse for prompt management
Acceptance Criteria:
* Prompts can be managed across environments - read, update, delete
* Prompts can be viewed against traces
*

Title 2: Langfuse with SQLPad and Jupyter for codebase isolated development
Acceptance Criteria: * Langfuse/SQLPad user flows to remove codebase touchpoints for usecase MLEs and remove dependecy on code migrations

Title 2: Live response status
Acceptance Criteria: * Loader state updates to the current step when it starts and ends with all intermediate information when step finishes (currently only updated when the step ends)

Title 2: Simplified execution logs
Acceptance Criteria:
* Execution logs for each step is simplified for the user to go through
* Relatable and relevant information in paragraph/clean formatting is used for ease of reading and explainability
* Execution logs are retained in response for review from user on how the response was generated

Title 2: IC NL2SQL improvement via Tredence POC
Acceptance Criteria:
* Improved NL2SQL accuracy post integration
* Config options for selecting primary and fallback tools - IC NL2SQL, DBRX Genie, Vanna
